alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:17AM EST until December 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...New Jersey... Delaware River At Easton-Phillipsburg affecting Hunterdon, Northampton and Warren Counties. For the Delaware River...including Easton-Phillipsburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Delaware River at Easton-Phillipsburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Backwater from the Delaware causes flooding in Easton along the Lehigh River At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins upstream in Harmony Station New Jersey and Sandts Eddy Pennsylvania. At 24.0 feet, Larry Holmes Drive in Easton is subject to flooding. Riverside Way in Phillipsburg is flooded in the area of the boat ramp. At 25.0 feet, Portions of Bushkill Drive and Route 611 are flooded due to a combination of Delaware River flooding and backwater effects on Bushkill Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 20.7 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 24.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.9 feet on 03/08/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Delaware River Easton-Phillips 22.0 20.7 Tue 1 am 23.4 14.9 24.0 7pm 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 230 PM EST.
